Description: Leaf-shaped arrowhead of pale translucent flint, pointed at both ends. Carefully retouched bifacially.
Curator's comments: Called a lens-shaped arrow-head by D.Holmes in The Predynastic Lithic Industries of Upper Egypt, v. ii (oxford 1989), 416. This arrowhead and the three others like it found in the same tomb (see EA 59650, 59652) were considered to be amongst the finest examples of Badarian flint work known to the excavator.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (7, 37; pl. xxix.6) (lower row middle)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
